Reviews.Title: Exactly as described.
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Using it with a fi9821w .  I was able to paint the enclosure to match my house (hoa).  Protects the camera well.  (Not air tight).  Biggest concern where I live is direct sunlight and this does the job.  Very easy to mount (make sure you buy stucco screws from Home Depot if you are mounting to stucco, don't use the screws included as they are meant for dry wall.  You MUST have an external light source for night time.  Read the description, the ir lights WILL reflect.  Unit did come with the power cord extension and a small cat 5 cable.  I would recommend using clear silicon around the units arm and your home if you are mounting outside.

Reviews.Title: Good solution if you want to use your indoor Foscam camera as an outdoor one
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Although I cannot recommend Foscam cameras due to manufacturing defects that has yet to be addressed, this enclosure is well worth the money if you want to use your indoor Foscam camera, such as the FI8910W, as an outdoor one.  The enclosure is rather large so careful planning needs to be made to make sure the enclosure fits and the view of the camera is sufficient for monitoring the area you wish to keep an eye on.  Besides silicone, it comes with everything you need to mount the enclosure including mounting screws, power extension cable for your Foscam camera and even cloth gloves to keep the dome portion smudge free!  Normally with an outdoor Foscam unit (and plan on having it wired instead of wireless), you will need to drill a significant hole (1 3/8") in order to route the camera connections into your home.  Since the network connection (RJ45 jack) is connected on the unit itself for indoor Foscam cameras, the hole needed is much smaller (1" or less) since you will only need the network and power cable for connections.  Overall I was satisfied with the fit and finish of this enclosure.Although the enclosure is of great quality, I had to take away one star because the IR lights reflect of the dome when they are turned on which essentially makes it useless for night vision.  This can be remedied with adding IR illuminators and turning the IR lights off on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Does the Job
Reviews.Author: R. Perry
Reviews.Content: The description doesn't mention this as of 5/1/2013, but it comes with a power cable extender and a network cable. I think its a bit overpriced, but it definitely protects the camera from the outdoor elements. The dome is plastic so be careful not to scratch it when putting it together, they even include white gloves to put it together with.

Reviews.Title: Well made dome enclosure
Reviews.Author: IM D1
Reviews.Content: Product came well packaged and on time.  Well made and is sturdy.  It includes a hex wrench, a pair of white cotton knit glove, among other items.  Mounting was simple, but remember a drill is needed to drill a small hole (about 1/2") from inside wall to outside wall/siding to run the supplied power cord from electric outlet to the mounted camera.  Excellent product, but is expensive.  Highly recommended if you bought an indoor camera and want to use it outside.  However, as with some other reviewers' comments, once you decide to use it outdoor, the IR feature that allows you to view without light at night becomes useless.  This is because the IR light will reflect light on the clear plastic dome enclosure back to the camera, not allowing a clear view of the surrounding.  I use the camera with the IR setting set to OFF.  If surveillance viewing at night is desired, you should have the outdoor lights on.

Reviews.Title: Little large, but...
Reviews.Author: JvK, Canton GA
Reviews.Content: Fits the Foscam IP cameras well, even the FI9826WB.  Built material is great - arm is metal and the rest is PVC. The unit is quite large.

Reviews.Title: Good Outdoor mount for Focam PTZ Cameras
Reviews.Author: Paul Lossner
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with quality and ease of installation.  Very good design.  IR will not work through dome at night however so outdoor lighting will be needed at night.  This is not dome housings fault but limitation of IR reflections.

Reviews.Title: Rugged and reliable.
Reviews.Author: Scott A. Hawk
Reviews.Content: As long as you know this will not work at night, then you will be fine.  It's easy to put together and very rugged, given it's bargain price.  I installed a fixed night camera and this unit with a movable camera near by.

Reviews.Title: This is a professional-quality dome
Reviews.Author: bottlenose
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the high quality of this dome. The packaging was excellent, and the instructions were in perfectly clear English (this was the biggest surprise to me). It even came with white gloves to wear while handling the clear plastic enclosure to ensure no finger prints were left behind. I'd absolutely recommend this to anyone wanting to put an indoor camera outside. I can't say much for the weatherproof capabilities, as I have it under an overhang that protects it from the sun, wind, and rain. It's an attractive unit that fits the Foscam FI8910W perfectly. Keep in mind that the infrared lights won't work in the dome, as the light just gets reflected back to the camera. So you must have external illumination (like, for example, from a motion-sensor light or a floodlight) to get a decent image at night. That's not a fault of the dome; it's just simple physics.

Reviews.Title: Works with my INSTEON camera
Reviews.Author: Lenny Scolaro
Reviews.Content: This dome works fine with my INSTEON indoor pan/tilt camera.  I was afraid that because the INSTEON camera is bigger than the Foscam that it wouldn't fit, but it fit just fine.  The construction is good, and the design well thought out.  My only gripe is that the dome reflects back the IR from the camera, but I knew that going in.  I could not find any dome enclosures that would fit my camer that didn't have that same shortcoming.  This would get 5 stars if they made the dome out of a material that would not reflect the IR.  I'm very happy with the purchase though and this is overall a very good product.

Reviews.Title: Good Enclosure
Reviews.Author: John Ford
Reviews.Content: Used in barn to monitor horses -- have not resolved IR reflection issue -- but works well in protecting my camera.

Reviews.Title: Good, simple enclosure
Reviews.Author: Brett Ferrell
Reviews.Content: A simple but adequate enclosure for my camera... has been up for a few weeks and seems to be doing very well for me.

Reviews.Title: No Instructions and Missing parts.
Reviews.Author: djkinvest "djkinvest"
Reviews.Content: Had to figure out how to put it together with my Foscam, Missing screws, and not sure how the antenna hooks into doom.

Reviews.Title: NOT for FI8910W owners wanting to use at night
Reviews.Author: GRey1
Reviews.Content: I have (4) Foscam FI8910W and decided to put two outside in domes to protect them, after all the description says that it is recommended for my cameras.  It also NOTEs that the dome will reflect IR lights.  What it should say is that it reflects the lights back rendering the camera absolutely useless.  You can't see squat.  It might be different if the IR lights had a setting so that they didn't automatically cut on, but they do.  So in order to use these darn things, you will have find an external IR light that has the proper frequency, order and install it (don't forget a power cord if it doesn't come with one) and them manually cut off the camera's IR every night.  I will be taking these down and probably buy the Agasio ones for outside.  This was not a good experience for me.UPDATE:After reading the reviews on the Agasio it appears to have the same problem. So domes + cams without night vision + external IR lights = winner.

Reviews.Title: Alright
Reviews.Author: Alright
Reviews.Content: Works good in the day but the image at night is so bad, you can't see anything. Plus the camera is reflected in the glass part of the dome.

Reviews.Title: Seems like it is bigger than it needs to be...
Reviews.Author: wintermute
Reviews.Content: Seems like they could have made it a bit smaller. Fairly big, but it works. You will need to also purchase external IR illuminators if you want to use your IR cam at night as this dome will reflect the IR light back into the camera. I wish Foscam made an outdoor pan & tilt camera so this bulky kludge would be unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: Very bad design
Reviews.Author: Morning "morning"
Reviews.Content: HUGE for no reaso but to hold antenna insideNo instructions, I have 4 small screws I don't know what to do with.Mount is hard to adjust and long, again for no reason.Plastic dome, so the antenna works inside.No external antenna, no way to use bigger antenna.I had to spend an hour drilling a hole for my extended antenna then hoping my caulking seal will work.
